title: Matrices as Functions - converting to matrix form

content.question: The linear transformation function <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> maps vector <math alttext="open angle brackets a comma b close angle brackets"><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math> to vector <math alttext="open angle brackets 2 a plus b comma 6 b close angle brackets"><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>b</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>. If <math alttext="L open parentheses vector v close parentheses equals uppercase A times vector v"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>, where <math alttext="uppercase A"><mi>A</mi></math> is a <math alttext="2 by 2"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>2</mn></math> matrix and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is a column vector, which of the following could define <math alttext="uppercase A"><mi>A</mi></math> ?
